Data.event_text: The telenovela Amar y vivir premiers on Colombian television.

links.text: -"¡De estreno! Amar y vivir, la historia que quiere robarse el corazón de los colombianos". bluradio.com (in Spanish). 7 January 2020. Retrieved 23 January 2020.-

Data.event_text: Colombia legally exports marijuana seeds to Colorado, the United States.

links.text: -de 2020, Por Jorge Cantillo7 de Mayo. "Por primera vez Colombia exportará marihuana legal a Estados Unidos". infobae (in European Spanish). Retrieved May 9, 2020.{{cite web}}:  CS1 maint: numeric names: authors list (link)-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 pandemic in Colombia Colombia reports a record of 752 new cases of the infection in one day, bringing the total to 17,787 with 630 deaths. Most of the cases are in Cartagena de Indias.

links.text: -"Colombia registró récord de 752 casos diarios de coronavirus". infobae (in European Spanish). Retrieved May 25, 2020.-

Data.event_text: Two men on the radio program ‘Buenas Tardes con Fabio’ in Valledupar, Cesar Department joke about human trafficking and sexual slavery and may be prosecuted.

links.text: -de 2020, Por Jorge Cantillo25 de Mayo. "Indignación en Colombia: un locutor de radio y un supuesto líder indígena bromearon sobre la compra de una niña aborigen como esclava sexual". infobae (in European Spanish). Retrieved May 25, 2020.{{cite web}}:  CS1 maint: numeric names: authors list (link)-

Data.event_text: The United States Army sends a Security Force Assistance Brigade unit to Colombia to train anti-drug forces for a period of four months.

links.text: -"U.S. unit to arrive in Colombia to help fight drug trafficking". news.yahoo.com. Retrieved May 29, 2020.-

Data.event_text: Indignation across social media due to the police beating to death of Anderson Arboleda, 21, for not wearing a facemask during the COVID-19 pandemic in Puerto Tejada, Cauca on . His case is being compared to that of George Floyd in the United States.

links.text: -Jorge Cantillo (June 4, 2020). "Indignación en Colombia por un caso similar al de George Floyd: un joven negro murió tras una golpiza policial". infobae (in European Spanish). Retrieved June 8, 2020.-

Data.event_text: A soldier, Ángel Zúñiga Galicia, removes his uniform and puts down his gun in refusal of an order to remove peasants from their home in Pance, Valle del Cauca Department.

links.text: -"Policía se quita el uniforme y da su arma cuando le ordenan que desalojar a campesinos". wapa.pe. wapa. Retrieved June 13, 2020.-

Data.event_text: Seven soldiers confess to raping a 12-year-old girl from the Embera Katio indigenous group, in the northwestern Risaralda Department.

links.text: -Pozzebon, Stefano; Arias, Tatiana (27 June 2020). "Colombian soldiers confess to sexually abusing indigenous girl, says Attorney General". CNN. Retrieved June 27, 2020.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 pandemic There are more than 400,000 confirmed cases and 13,500 deaths.

links.text: -"Colombia supera 400 mil casos de covid, muertes rondan 13 mil 500". Excélsior (in Spanish). 12 August 2020. Retrieved August 16, 2020.-

Data.event_text: The bodies of four coal miners are found after a cave-in sevendays ago in Sogamoso, Boyacá Department.

links.text: -Castillo, Jorge (August 14, 2020). "Triste final para una búsqueda: hallaron los cuerpos de los 4 mineros que habían quedado atrapados en Colombia". infobae (in European Spanish). Retrieved August 25, 2020.-

Data.event_text: Colombia requests the extradition of drug lord and paramilitary warlord Salvatore Mancuso, 56, on fears that he may be deported to Italy and released. Mancuso has been convicted over 1,000 murders and other crimes.

links.text: -Parkin Daniels, Joe. "Colombia calls on US to extradite warlord over fears he will escape justice". news.yahoo.com. The Guardian. Retrieved August 21, 2020.-

Data.event_text: Two thousand indigenous Arhuaco protest against armed groups who are seizing land in the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta.

links.text: -de 2020, Por Jorge Cantillo25 de Agosto. "Indígenas colombianos denunciaron incursión de grupos ilegales en sus territorios". infobae (in European Spanish). Retrieved August 25, 2020.{{cite web}}:  CS1 maint: numeric names: authors list (link)-

Data.event_text: Six young people are murdered in Tumaco, Nariño Department. This is the fourth massacre this week.
Three miners are rescued after being trapped for five days by a cave-in in Lenguazaque, Cundinamarca Department.

links.text: -Castillo, Jorge (August 24, 2020). "El emotivo rescate de tres mineros tras 5 días atrapados bajo tierra". infobae (in European Spanish). Retrieved August 25, 2020.-

Data.event_text: The Climate Green Fund of the United Nations donates US$28 million to prevent deforestation in the Amazon rainforest.

links.text: -Aguirre FES ACATLÁN, Jalil. "Donan 28 millones de dólares para luchar contra la deforestación en Colombia". www.msn.com. 24 Horas. Retrieved August 25, 2020.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 pandemic The number of cases passes 600,000.

links.text: -"Colombia sobrepasa 600.000 casos de coronavirus con 8.024 nuevos contagios". www.msn.com. EFE. Retrieved August 30, 2020.-

Data.event_text: Opening of La Línea road tunnel.

links.text: -Daniel Pardo (2020-09-04), "Túnel de la Línea: por qué Colombia se demoró 100 años en construir su obra más importante (y qué beneficios traerá su inauguración)" [The Linea Tunnel: why it took Colombia 100 years to build its most important project (and what benefits its opening will bring)], BBC Mundo (in Spanish), retrieved 2025-03-17-

Data.event_text: Protests following the death of Javier Ordóñez, 42, at the hands of police leave seven dead and 140 injured in Bogota and Soacha.

links.text: -"Disturbios en Colombia: al menos siete muertos y 140 heridos en medio de las protestas contra el abuso policial". infobae (in European Spanish). September 9, 2020. Retrieved September 10, 2020.-

Data.event_text: Protests against police brutality leave ten dead, 209 civilians injured, 194 police injured, and 17 police kiosks burned in Bogotá, Medellín, Cali, and Manizales.

links.text: -Parkin Daniels, joe (September 11, 2020). "Colombia protests against police brutality leave at least 10 dead". news.yahoo.com. Bogotá: The Guardian. Retrieved Sep 13, 2020.-

Data.event_text: A statue of Spanish conquistador Sebastián de Belalcázar is torn down by indigenous Misak in Popayán, Cauca Department in protest of 500 years of slavery and oppression.

links.text: -"Indígenas tumbaron la estatua del conquistador español Sebastián de Belalcázar en el suroeste de Colombia". infobae (in European Spanish). September 16, 2020. Retrieved Sep 17, 2020.-

Data.event_text: COVID-19 pandemic Colombia reports 1,191,634 positive cases, ninth highest number in the world.

links.text: -"México se convirtió en el cuarto país latinoamericano en acumular un millón de contagios COVID-19". infobae (in European Spanish). November 15, 2020. Retrieved November 15, 2020.-

Data.event_text: The United Nations Office of the Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR), reported it recorded the deaths of 255 people in 66 massacres in 2020, as well as the killing of 120 human rights defenders.

links.text: -"UN documents 375 killings in Colombia in 2020, urges Government action". UN News. 2020-12-15. Retrieved 2021-01-17.-
